lead_paragraph: Advocacy groups and the Justice Department said a state education campaign ordered in a previous court ruling made voters think voting would be harder than it is.

headline.print_headline: Justice Dept. and Advocacy Groups Accuse Texas of Misleading Voters Without IDs
headline.main: Court Filing Accuses Texas of Misleading Voters Without IDs

snippet: Advocacy groups and the Justice Department said a state education campaign ordered in a previous court ruling made voters think voting would be harder than it is....
abstract: Voting rights advocates and federal lawyers file motions in Federal District Court in Corpus Christi, Tex, regarding state's voter education campaign and requirements for voters without official government IDs; motions stem from lower court ordering state officials to let people without IDs vote by signing statement they cannot reasonably obtain required documentation.
